course: The World of the Hebrew Bible
course_desc: The World of the Hebrew Bible - The Hebrew Bible in the cultural setting of the ancient Near East; the formation of theological and ethical concepts which have shaped Western culture.

The Mediterranean: A Religious History - Explores multiple religious traditions of the Mediterranean as networks that emerge within and among the landscapes, cultures, and politics of this highly interconnected geographic space.
Jerusalem, City of Three Faiths - History of Jerusalem as a window onto the nature of the three Abrahamic faiths.

course: The World of the New Testament
course_desc: The World of the New Testament - Historical investigation of New Testament characters, events, ethics and theology in relation to its social, intellectual, and religious contexts in the Jewish and Greco-Roman world.

course: The World of the New Testament
course_desc: The World of the New Testament - Historical investigation of New Testament characters, events, ethics and theology in relation to its social, intellectual, and religious contexts in the Jewish and Greco-Roman world.

Introduction to Christianity - Survey of the changing beliefs and practices of the Christian religion from obscure origins to globalized present, with special attention to the varieties of Christian literature.
Introduction to Buddhism - Focus primarily on works of Buddhist literature written in a;variety of genres. Introduction of basic teachings that link;Buddhist traditions across time and space.
Chinese Religions and Culture - Historical and thematic survey of Chinese religious history from earliest times to the present.

course: Sense and Sensuality in Indian Religions and Culture
course_desc: Sense and Sensuality in Indian Religions and Culture - Exploration of the senses and the technologies of pleasure in India, relating this material to some fascinating examples of Hindu, Jain, and Buddhist literature.
Global Religions in Los Angeles - Congregational and individual expressions of religion in Los Angeles.

course: Introduction to the Study of Religion
course_desc: Introduction to the Study of Religion - Survey of academic approaches to the study of religion. When possible this course will be taken during the first year of the major or minor.
Biblical Wisdom Literature - Survey of and inquiry into the biblical wisdom literature; emphasis on the Book of Job.
Thought and Life of Islam - History, thought, institutions, and religious practices of Islam.

course: The Bible in Its Ancient Context
course_desc: The Bible in Its Ancient Context - A close consideration of ancient Near Eastern myths--especially those from Mesopotamia and Canaan--with special attention to their influence on the Bible.
Religions of Japan - The development of religious thought and practice in the Japanese;islands, with Buddhism and Shinto being the most prominent.
Re-Viewing Religion in Asian America - Interdisciplinary analysis of the religions traditions, institutions, and experiences of Asians and Pacific Islanders in the U.S.

Introduction to Indian Philosophy - An introduction to Indian philosophy, including major schools of thought in Hindu, Buddhist, and Jain philosophies. No previous knowledge of Indian religions or philosophy required.
Islamic Mysticism: Sufism - Examination of the origins, development, and basic concepts and practices of Sufism, as well as its relationship to other areas of Islamic life.

course: Drugs, Alcohol, Visions and Altered States in Religion
course_desc: Drugs, Alcohol, Visions and Altered States in Religion - Examines the history and meaning of drugs, alcohol and altered states of mind in world religions across history.
Seminar in Religious Studies - Survey of methods and selected issues in the field of religious studies; required of all majors during their junior or senior year. Recommended preparation: REL 301.

course: Cultural Heritage, Religion, and Politics in the Middle East
course_desc: Cultural Heritage, Religion, and Politics in the Middle East - In-depth exploration of archaeology and heritage issues in the Middle East and their implications for politics and practice in modern Islam, Judaism and Christianity.
Religion and Violence - Religious and moral perspectives on war, pacifism, violent and non-violent protest, and religion-based terrorism and militia.;
History of Religion in America - Intellectual, institutional, and social history of religion in America from colonial times to the present.

course: Religion and Popular Culture in the United States
course_desc: Religion and Popular Culture in the United States - Critical analysis of the relationship between religion, mass;media, and popular cultural forms in the U.S. Recommended;preparation: REL 301

course_desc: Quality Assurance, Medical Devices and Combination Products - Design of systems according to FDA and international regulations and guidelines to ensure the quality and safety of medical devices and combination products.

Recommended preparation: undergraduate degree in pharmacy, medical or independent health sciences, engineering or equivalent mix of post-secondary training and industry experience; enrollment in M.S., Regulatory Science, certificate in Preclinical Drug Development.

course: Theory, Methods and Practice of Medical Products Research
course_desc: Theory, Methods and Practice of Medical Products Research - Statistical and research design methods, data analysis, survey and interview techniques laying the foundation for the dissertation

course: The History and Geography of Drugs
course_desc: The History and Geography of Drugs - Global perspectives; discovery and use of drugs (legal/illegal); poisons. How they helped shape, modify or change history as described in classical literature through present day.

course: The History and Geography of Drugs
course_desc: The History and Geography of Drugs - Global perspectives; discovery and use of drugs (legal/illegal); poisons. How they helped shape, modify or change history as described in classical literature through present day.

Drug/Receptor interactions, pharmacodynamics, pharmacokinetics, toxicology, therapeutic interventions, biotransformation, pharmacogenomics, FDA, regulatory requirements and challenges, intellectual property, global challenges of drug development.

course: Human Pharmacology: Challenge of Therapeutics in Society
course_desc: Human Pharmacology: Challenge of Therapeutics in Society - Principles of human pharmacology/toxicology related to prescription, over the counter medications; nutraceuticals; drug-drug interactions; polypharmacy; hot topics related to recently approved drugs.

course: Pharmacology and Sociology of Drug Abuse
course_desc: Pharmacology and Sociology of Drug Abuse - Social, psychological, economical, biological reasons associated with drug use/abuse; Prevention strategies; Pharmacology and Pharmacotherapy Successes/ Challenges; Current trends; Case studies; Roles of health care professionals

course: The Discovery, Development and Marketing of Medicines
course_desc: The Discovery, Development and Marketing of Medicines - Principles, concepts, challenges and short comings of modern day drug discovery and development of medicines. Inter-relationships with regulatory, ethical and societal sectors presented.

course: Buzzed: Modern Substances of Abuse and Addiction
course_desc: Buzzed: Modern Substances of Abuse and Addiction - Modern perspectives; discovery and use of legal and illicit drugs including alcohol and opioids. How drugs have helped, shaped, modified or changed individuals and society.

course: Medical Products: From Idea to Market
course_desc: Medical Products: From Idea to Market - Progress of medical product development through intellectual property, animal and clinical trials and commercialization. Emphasis on safety, quality systems and efficacy.

course: Organ Physiology, Drug Delivery, and Drug Action
course_desc: Organ Physiology, Drug Delivery, and Drug Action - Principles of cellular and organ physiology. Interplay between the physiology of these organ systems, drug delivery, and drug action.

course: Historical and Contemporary Stem Cell Research
